    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This main method is used to build the visual and call the methods to write and read the music. The main method also initializes the variables later used for parameters, including the chord progressions.
        Parameters:
        args - This parameter is not used for PlayTune and is ignored

      • pixel

        public static void pixel(int pitch,
                         double duration)
        This method draws a visual that corresponds to the music being played
        Parameters:
        pitch - This is used for setting pen color
        duration - This is used for setting rectangle height

      • sum

        public static double[] sum(double[] a,
                           double[] b,
                           double awt,
                           double bwt)
        This method returns the weighted sum of two arrays
        Parameters:
        a - This is the first array
        b - This is the second array
        awt - This is the value a is weighted by
        bwt - This is the value a is weighted by
        Returns:
        double[] This method returns an array[] of the weighted sums

      • tone

        public static double[] tone(double hz,
                            double duration,
                            double sound)
        This method creates a pure tone of the given frequency for the given duration
        Parameters:
        hz - This is the frequency value
        duration - This is length a note is to be played
        sound - This is the amplitude value
        Returns:
        double[] This method returns an array[] comprized of pure tones

      • echo

        public static double[] echo(int repetitions,
                            double[] pitch,
                            double scale,
                            double delay)
        This method returns an array of the echod sound
        Parameters:
        repetitions - the number of repetitions
        pitch - the audio to echo
        scale - scale of volume decrease each echo
        delay - time between each echo
        Returns:
        Returns the echoed values
        Throws:
        java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException - if delay is negative

        Parameters:
        pitch - the audio o scale
        scale - the scale factor for the amplitude
        Returns:
